description.narrative: The project development objective (PDO) is to strengthen the capacity of the GoK to manage its petroleum sector and wealth for sustainable development impacts.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Co-financing deadline for effectiveness | Description :The co-financing deadline for effectiveness of theco-financing Agreement is December 30, 2016. (Financing Agreement, Article 4.01) | Due Date :30-Dec-2016

The Recipient shall: (a) by no later than Dec 30, 2016 prepare a SESA, under the terms of reference satisfactory to theAssociation; (b) adopt an action plan to carry out the SESA, and disclose no later than nine months after its adoption; and (c)promptly implement said action plan. (Financing Agreement, Schedule 2, Section I, E)| Due Date: 30-Dec-2016

title.narrative: Percentage of petroleum production and transmission projects per year subject to formal environmental and safety inspections following good international practices set under the project
Staff of petroleum sector management institutions trained to regulate, manage and monitor compliance in the sector
Policy, legal and regulatory acts, prepared under the project, approved and in force (legally effective) by relevant sector ministries

baseline.value: No acts prepared under the project

target.value: Key Policy and Legal Acts approved and in force

actual.value: Petroleum Act 2019 & new Model PSA in force.Energy & Petroleum Policy 2019 in forceDevelopment of a stand-alone Petroleum Policy.Contract signed, under implementation.Development of Upstream petroleum regulations. Contract signed, under implementation.Reviewof mid and downstream petroleum on-going.The first Occupational Safety and Health (OSH) Regulation for the sector petroleumcompleted Review of Environmental Regulations on-going.Development of Resettlement Policy Framework - completedDraft SovereignWealth Fund (SWF) Bill - with Solicitor General for legal drafting.Development of oil & gas standards consultancy temporarily – ongoing

title.narrative: Report published, and made publicly available, in accordance with internationally recognized transparency standards.
Number of public agencies plus organizations engaged in transparency and community monitoring trained on transperancy monitoring across the extractive sector value chain
Number of staff trained at Treasury to forecast, collect, and manage oil revenues.

Number of staff from DOSHS and other lead agencies responsible for enforcement of safety and health regulation in the sector (e.g. ERC, Petroleum Authority) that have completed sector-relevant trainin
Number of staff from MEP, NOCK, ERC, KPC, OAGDJ and Petroleum Authority that have completed sector-relevant training funded throughthe KEPTAP project
A new regulatory body for the petroleum sector, "Kenya Petroleum Authority", reporting to the Cabinet Secretary of MEP, is established and functional

baseline.value: Kenya Petroleum Authority does not exist

target.value: First deliverable issued (e.g.Field Development Plan reviewed/approved, exploration license approved, etc.)

actual.value: Consultancy on institutional development of Upstream Petroleum Regulatory Authority coming to a close. Final report receivedawaiting technical committee review and approval.

title.narrative: NOCK is restructured in order to execute its mandate as a National Oil Company that may take commercial positions in oil and gas license as well as represents the State Participation in Joint Ventures

actual.value: NOCK is not restructuredConsultancy on NOCK transformation plan is on-going with the consultant currently undertaking phase 2 ofthe assignment.

title.narrative: Fiscal policy rule in place for transfer of oil/gas revenue to the annual budget

baseline.value: No Fiscal policy on transfer of oil/gas revenues

target.value: Fiscal rule in place and enforced

actual.value: No Fiscal policy on transfer of oil/gas revenues A procedure manual for Petroleum Tax Administration Office for Kenya RevenueAdministration is completed

title.narrative: Local content policy approved and effective

actual.value: Draft Local Content policy and local content regulations delivered awaiting government approval.

title.narrative: A dedicated gender assessment identifying any potential gender-specific impacts of the sector is completed

actual.value: Gender Assessment finalized but the scope reviewed to upgrade the assessment.Consultant hired and assignment ongoing. Interimreport received and cleared.

title.narrative: A comprehensive stand-alone Petroleum Policy that covers both upstream and downstream aspects approved and effective

actual.value: Energy & Petroleum Policy 2019 in forceDevelopment of a stand-alone Petroleum Policy contracted and has moved to implementationstage with virtual kick-off meeting already conducted.

title.narrative: Operating cost do not exceed 15% of total project cost by the closing date of the project
